title:u/pandapaxxy's Season 20, Lightfall And Season Of Defiance
description:Originally found at https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/12kyvei/lightfall_seasonal_breakdown/

// Acasia's Dejection
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(1000) Solar Trace Rifle Special Ammo.  "Acacia's Dejection is a super fun trace rifle with Reconstruction and Target Lock. Paracausal Affinity is great for instant 20 percent damage. Depending on what you’d like to use this trace rifle for you can either blitz majors and champs with it or clear out rooms of enemies with incredible damage. I would definitely farm for this trace rifle." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Acasia's Dejection (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(1000) Solar Trace Rifle Special Ammo.  "Acacia's Dejection is a super fun trace rifle with Reconstruction and Target Lock. Paracausal Affinity is great for instant 20 percent damage. Depending on what you’d like to use this trace rifle for you can either blitz majors and champs with it or clear out rooms of enemies with incredible damage. I would definitely farm for this trace rifle." |tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3493494807&perks=1840239774,2680121939,968510818,365154968

// Allied Demand
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Allied Demand is extremely similar to Buzzard, however, there will be no adept mods to bring up stats or damage in PvE. Rapid Hit is by and large the best perk to look for. Subsistence is also good if you’re in lower tiered PvE. Frenzy is the best in slot perk with either third column perk. Multikill Clip pairs better with Rapid Hit than Subsistence." |tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3166250992&perks=1840239774,1087426260,247725512,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=3166250992&perks=1482024992,1087426260,247725512,4104185692

// Astral Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Astral Horizon graces yet again. No quickdraw but that’s okay. One-Two Punch and Pugilist are the best combos together, but lack a reliable reload perk. Surplus and Slideshot both reload your weapon but it’s not the same as Auto-Loading Holster or Grave Robber." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(540) Kinetic Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Autumn Wind is a fun return to our sandbox. Arrowhead Brake is a must have on these pulses. 93 recoil direction is near perfect for PvE, but I would hesitate to bring a rapid-fire frame into higher end PvE. Demolitionist and Frenzy are great on grenade heavy builds. Freny brings up the reload so you won’t have to invest hard into that one particular stat." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Basso Ostinato
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(140) Void Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Basso Ostinato is an interesting shotgun. We have gotten a few new aggressive frame shotguns recently, especially within this DLC. The interesting thing about this shotgun is the inclusion of Nanotech Tracer Rockets pushes this shotgun a little over the edge compared to its brothers and sisters. You will want to increase Basso Ostinato’s handling to make swaps a lot less painful. Envious Assassin and Grave Robber are great options depending on what you’re using this shotgun for and with. If you are using Basso Ostinato as a DPS weapon or mob killer, then something like Trench Barrel or Destabilizing Rounds will be perfect with Envious Assassin. If you punch a lot you can pair Grave Robber with either of the punchy perks." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Briar's Contempt
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Charge Time. Aggressive(533) Solar Linear Fusion Rifle Heavy Ammo.  "Briar’s Contempt might be better than Stormchaser or Fire and Forget. Being able to slot Adept mods is incredibly useful. That alongside Reconstruction and Frenzy could make for a solid DPS weapon. It loses 5 percent of damage without Firing Line but does make up for that in non-precision damage. Firing Line only deals bonus precision damage. Will the extra magazine make up for the lack of damage? I know Adept Big Ones will certainly make up for it. Being able to use this fusion against any beefy enemy regardless of spec mod you have on is perfect." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Briar's Contempt (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Charge Time. Aggressive(533) Solar Linear Fusion Rifle Heavy Ammo.  "Briar’s Contempt might be better than Stormchaser or Fire and Forget. Being able to slot Adept mods is incredibly useful. That alongside Reconstruction and Frenzy could make for a solid DPS weapon. It loses 5 percent of damage without Firing Line but does make up for that in non-precision damage. Firing Line only deals bonus precision damage. Will the extra magazine make up for the lack of damage? I know Adept Big Ones will certainly make up for it. Being able to use this fusion against any beefy enemy regardless of spec mod you have on is perfect." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Buzzard
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "I loved Buzzard for the few seasons we had it. Now that it can roll Adept mods I love it even more. In PvE you can roll Kinetic Tremors which will give Buzzard a bit more utility in higher-end content. Overflow is arguably one of my favorite perks in the game. Perpetual Motion also needs you to be mobile, easy with a sidearm as you have to get close. Compulsive Reloader is easy to use but falls off quickly with the low magazine size." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Buzzard (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "I loved Buzzard for the few seasons we had it. Now that it can roll Adept mods I love it even more. In PvE you can roll Kinetic Tremors which will give Buzzard a bit more utility in higher-end content. Overflow is arguably one of my favorite perks in the game. Perpetual Motion also needs you to be mobile, easy with a sidearm as you have to get close. Compulsive Reloader is easy to use but falls off quickly with the low magazine size." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Circular Logic
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(450) Strand Machine Gun Heavy Ammo.  "I am glad we are getting more 450 machine guns. They just feel the overall in PvP, PvE, and PvEvP. They might not always be meta but they feel good to shoot without investing a lot into their stats. If you run Arrowhead Brake you will have perfect recoil, Envious Assassin will overflow the magazine. Target Lock or Vorpal Weapon will be dependent on whether or not you use this as a boss killer or multi-tool. You could also make this your add-clearing machine with Hatchling and Feeding Frenzy." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Impact. Vortex(20) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "I love that warlocks get a spin-to-win sword. I would love to see class agnostic heavy and lightweight frame swords, but I digress. For Death's Razor you'll want similar rolls to your old Falling Guillotines. The difference would be Valiant Charge for a bit more zoom. Duelist's Trance for better charge rate. Or Destabilizing Rounds for better add clear while maintaining some good damage. Lots to do with more utility over Guillotine which was only damage." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hung Jury SR4
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Precision(180) Kinetic Scout Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Hung Jury SR4 makes its fourth return. While I never got behind this weapon I am upset that Hung Jury SR4 has had three different versions in D2 and its original version in D1. Give me back the Black Armory weapons please and thank you. In terms of this new-new version of Hung Jury SR4 you will want Kinetic Tremors or Firefly for your AoE damage. Frenzy gives you some great damage coupled with any spec mod. Rapid Hit is a bit overkill for reload but gives decent stability. Arrowhead Brake brings up the recoil direction to 100 for an easy shooting experience." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Imperial Decree
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Surrounded being baked into itself is extremely fun for shotguns like the Imperial Decree. Your damage is already strong per shot and you're making it even stronger with a spec mod, surge mods, and surrounded. Auto-Loading Holster is for stow and shoot. But Surplus can bring up your handling and reload speed if you don't use your abilities often." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(500) Arc Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "Iterative Loop needs better recoil direction. You might almost want to run counterbalance mod on it at all times. Accelerated Coils bumps up your damage per second. Lead from Gold is a very fun build and this could be a great major / champ killer. Compulsive Reloader and Voltshot would make a great pairing and clear rooms quickly. Not quite as strong as Reservoir Burst but an interesting arc alternative." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Jorum's Claw
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(390) Solar Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Hey hey, a “new” not so new weapon. Unlike the last few this is truly a reprised version. Jorum’s Claw is a fun pulse that needs Arrowhead Brake to even be considered useful. In PvE you really don’t have a lot of choice. Outlaw and Arrowhead Brake are required. A mag extending perk is useful but not required. Frenzy does limit the need for outlaw but there aren’t really a lot of perks in that column I would take. Golden Tricorn has become one of my favorite perks to recommend for the sheer damage coupled with our current surge mods." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Koraxis's Distress
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(150) Strand Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "The raid designs are incredible but I loathe typing out these names. Koraxis’s Distress is nothing special. Paracausal Affinity will bump up your damage with either a kill or a Strand kill. Easily making it one of the better choices for damage perks. Frenzy is tried and true and also brings up your reload to match. Reconstruction will bypass that, and Chain Reaction will allow you to dual flex into add clear and damage but I think Koraxis’s Distress might be best suited for a quick mag dump with bonus damage." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Koraxis's Distress (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(150) Strand Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "The raid designs are incredible but I loathe typing out these names. Koraxis’s Distress is nothing special. Paracausal Affinity will bump up your damage with either a kill or a Strand kill. Easily making it one of the better choices for damage perks. Frenzy is tried and true and also brings up your reload to match. Reconstruction will bypass that, and Chain Reaction will allow you to dual flex into add clear and damage but I think Koraxis’s Distress might be best suited for a quick mag dump with bonus damage." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Marsilion-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Rapid-Fire(150) Solar Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "Marsilion-C is an interesting grenade launcher. It doesn't do anything special to set itself apart from other grenade launchers in its class but it is craftable. Meaning you can create your 5/5. If you like pure damage you can roll with Field Prep for faster reloads and more reserves and your choice of damage perks. Full Court for longer ranged damage phases, Explosive Light stacked with surge mods, and Vorpal for plain Jane damage. Or you can invest more into add clear with Envious Assassin to overflow the magazine (also good for quicker damage phases) and Incandescent for ‘splosions!" |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Mindbender's Ambition
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(55) Solar Shotgun Special Ammo.  "I am both happy and sad that I am, yet again, talking about Mindbender’s Ambition. I am so very over this gun existing but it is certainly a solid aggressive frame shotgun. Being able to focus it makes this shotgun more accessible. Meaning more prevalent and more common. Please just do not bring back Spare Rations. I love that gun but we do not need it. Mindbender’s in PvE sits in an interesting position, it can get adept mods for more oomph, but it also doesn’t roll grave robber to make the use of One-Two Punch. Pugilist is great for more melee energy on Warlocks but not every class needs more melee energy." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Mindbender's Ambition (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(55) Solar Shotgun Special Ammo.  "I am both happy and sad that I am, yet again, talking about Mindbender’s Ambition. I am so very over this gun existing but it is certainly a solid aggressive frame shotgun. Being able to focus it makes this shotgun more accessible. Meaning more prevalent and more common. Please just do not bring back Spare Rations. I love that gun but we do not need it. Mindbender’s in PvE sits in an interesting position, it can get adept mods for more oomph, but it also doesn’t roll grave robber to make the use of One-Two Punch. Pugilist is great for more melee energy on Warlocks but not every class needs more melee energy." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. High-Impact(340) Arc Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Phyllotactic Spiral almost needs Arrowhead Brake to be viable in PvE. // Roar of the Bear
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. High-Impact(15) Solar Rocket Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "Rocket Launchers have been around for so long it’s hard for any of them to break out. Damage is best reserved for Adept weapons or specific perks. Roar of the Bear does not get either of those. Vorpal is low stakes decent damage. Lasting Impression is great for killing yourself (ask me how I know) and Chain Reaction is best used when trying to clear adds. None of these are uncommon on other rockets within the last few seasons." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Round Robin
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(120) Strand Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "What a happy little surprise to bless my smol paws. I don’t have to grind Moon bounties to get a Kill Clip 120? And it’s craftable for all those bonuses and longer Kill Clip? I love it! Keep Away is an incredible perk on 120s as they unusually duel on the end of hand cannon ranges. Killing Wind is also great paired with Kill Clip. You could also opt for Opening Shot for maximum range on that first shot or as a clean up from a long range sniper body shot." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Royal Executioner
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(600) Solar Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "Royal Executioner is an incredibly strong fusion rifle to add to your arsenal. Envious Assassin paired with Reservoir Burst will clear rooms very quickly. Grave Robber with Pugilist is a great combo, and you can also roll with Lead from Gold if you want to double stack special weapons. Royal Executioner would pair really well with either a Disorienting Grenade Launcher or a pure DPS shotgun like Heritage." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Rapid-Fire(720) Strand Auto Rifle Primary Ammo. // Senuna SI6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Omolon Adaptive(491) Stasis Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Boy do I love these Omolon sidearms. They just feel so good to use. Omolon Fluid Dynamics aside, these have always been one of my favorite classes of sidearms. Being that Senuna SI6 is stasis, the best perk for it is Headstone. Being able to slow and deal AoE damage off of a single kill is extremely strong. We all know how strong Disorienting Grenades are. Slow is just a different version of that. I don’t have to tell you all that. Feeding Frenzy is your best bet if you are “maining” this sidearm, but Envious Assassin could be fun. I don’t love it on primary ammo weapons as you should be using these the most, but depending on your build you could be swapping more than me. Another great perk to look out for is Golden Tricorn. Less useful if you don’t use Stasis, but extremely strong now with our current surge mods." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Inquisitor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Pinpoint Slug(65) Arc Shotgun Special Ammo.  "FILO and Gunnora’s Axe have some competition in PvE. The Inquisitor looks to do the job of both add clear and damage. Golden Tricorn blows Vorpal out of the water and Fourth Time’s the Charm adds more shots into your magazine to keep that damage going. Subsistence with and damage bonus could allow you to use Inquisitor as your main add-clear weapon or just something to nuke majors and champs with. Niche but interesting to see." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Militia's Birthright
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Lightweight(90) Kinetic Grenade Launcher Special Ammo.  "Militia’s Birthright is a great re-re-return. Ambitious Assassin is best in slot but I do wish Auto-Loading Holster was in the third column instead of the fourth. Frenzy does give you 100 reload speed so you won’t have to invest in reload unless you don’t have Frenzy up. One for All is also another great shout as you can hit three enemies all at once for an instant damage increase." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// THE SWARM
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. High-Impact(360) Arc Machine Gun Heavy Ammo.  "Feeding Frenzy is the best in slot for keeping your mag topped off. Target Lock and Golden Tricorn are going to be your best damage perks if you like running arc in Pve. I would recommend any mag extending perk as Feeding Frenzy should make up for your reload. The Swarm fits a niche in between a pure damage and a pure add-clear machine gun." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// THE SWARM (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. High-Impact(360) Arc Machine Gun Heavy Ammo.  "Feeding Frenzy is the best in slot for keeping your mag topped off. Target Lock and Golden Tricorn are going to be your best damage perks if you like running arc in Pve. I would recommend any mag extending perk as Feeding Frenzy should make up for your reload. The Swarm fits a niche in between a pure damage and a pure add-clear machine gun." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Title
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(750) Void Submachine Gun Primary Ammo.  "I don’t know about the Title coming back this season. It is better than Cold Front in every stat except for handling and recoil direction. The Title doesn’t have any good reload perks other than artificially increasing the magazine through Envious Assassin, moving with Perpetual Motion, or having enemies near you with Threat Detector. I don’t know about you but I sometimes prefer just a good reload perk. Threat Detector and Surrounded will make quick work of just about any horde mode, but falls off as soon as you’re out of combat. Vorpal is plain Jane damage and Repulsor Brace only works with void debuffs. If the Title rolled with Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace it would be a different conversation." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Trust
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Aggressive(180) Solar Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "Trust has also returned to us from the archives. Being able to roll more perks than ever before is both a blessing and a curse. Rapid Hit is best in slot, Outlaw or Triple Tap are great for a quick reload or extending the magazine. Incandescent will clear groups of enemies, but 180 hand cannons just aren’t PvE meta. They do feel fantastic to shoot, I will give them that. Frenzy will bring up your reload so you won’t necessarily need a reload perk, and Solar is an easy enough class to keep Golden Tricorn up consistently. Whichever floats your boat." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Unwavering Duty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(450) Solar Machine Gun Heavy Ammo.  "Hammerhead. Hammerhead. Hammerhead. Definitely a great addition to any Guardian’s arsenal. Especially if you rock Lead from Gold builds to keep Unwavering Duty as your main add clear weapon." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(120) Arc Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "I don’t super know what to say about Wendigo GL3 that hasn’t already been said. There is a niche burst damage roll with Clown Cartridge and Cascade Point. Clown Cartridge will give you a nine round magazine and if you can get Cascade Point going you’ll have a 200 RPM grenade launcher for an incredibly quick mag dump. In general you might want Auto-Loading Holster or Field Prep and either Explosive Light or Frenzy for general damage. Chain Reaction and Golden Tricorn will be incredibly strong together for add-clear." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3 (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Reload. Adaptive(120) Arc Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "I don’t super know what to say about Wendigo GL3 that hasn’t already been said. There is a niche burst damage roll with Clown Cartridge and Cascade Point. Clown Cartridge will give you a nine round magazine and if you can get Cascade Point going you’ll have a 200 RPM grenade launcher for an incredibly quick mag dump. In general you might want Auto-Loading Holster or Field Prep and either Explosive Light or Frenzy for general damage. Chain Reaction and Golden Tricorn will be incredibly strong together for add-clear." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Draw Time. Lightweight(850) Kinetic Combat Bow Primary Ammo. Kill Clip is the best damage perk you have and will refresh on every shot but Whistler’s Whim just doesn't have the perk pool to go higher than low tier PvE or Gambit." |tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Whistler's Whim (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Recommended MW: Draw Time. Lightweight(850) Kinetic Combat Bow Primary Ammo.  "Lightweight Frame bows have not been meta within PvE but are strong contenders for quick double taps and follow up shots. Kill Clip is the best damage perk you have and will refresh on every shot but Whistler’s Whim just doesn't have the perk pool to go higher than low tier PvE or Gambit." |tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=161675590&perks=2801223209,3429800428,247725512,1015611457

// Allied Demand
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range or Stability. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can have near 100 range and an 18.71m range. However, if you opt for a different barrel instead of Full Bore you can still maintain an 18m range drop off. If you prefer a bit more stability, even just Rapid hit 3x and Iron Reach can keep the stability respectable at 56. Still less than the base of 67 but the added benefits of an increasing stability in a gunfight can give you the edge." |tags:pvp,controller

// Astral Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,controller

// Astral Horizon (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,controller

// Autumn Wind
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Rapid-Fire(540) Kinetic Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "It’s always fun when a weapon drops where it should perform. Arrowhead Brake and a counterbalance mod bring up the recoil direction to 100. Ricochet Rounds will bring up the stability or you can push out more flinch with High-Caliber Rounds. Rangefinder is in slot, but you can always increase your range through Killing Wind or more stability through Heating Up. If you would like a more stat boosted weapon you can roll with Elemental Capacitor and choose how this gun reacts." |tags:pvp,controller

// Basso Ostinato
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range or Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Void Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Basso Ostinato does not compete well in PvP. Opening Shot does make up one of the two incredible shotgun perks. However, Perpetual Motion does not stack up as well compared to Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion 2x is still not even as strong of a handling buff as Threat Detector 1x. You will want to crank up the handling as much as possible. You will be okay using this shotgun at its possible version, however, you will just do better with a more dedicated PvP shotgun." |tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1300023272,3142289711,1428297954,47981717

// Buzzard
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Buzzard with Rangefinder will have a 17m range, going all into range will only bump that up to 18m. I would highly recommend just investing your stats into making the gun feel better as your range will just not bump up the same way. You can max out stability without a lot of investments and Perpetual Motion 2x. Buzzard is an incredibly strong sidearm with incredible stats. Definitely give it a try if you like sidearms." |tags:pvp,controller

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Compressed Wave(120) Stasis Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "I did not test this grenade launcher for a long period of time in PvP, but the same thing kept creeping into my mind. Having a heavy weapon that doesn’t one shot like its archetype siblings is just wrong. Having to fire twice and rely on architectures and level surfaces to kill is incredibly unfun. Do not use this in PvP until it gets a damage buff. Disruption Break is the perk for now as it will reliably break shields. I might update this once Dimensional Hypotrochoid gets a buff." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo. The good news is that Irukandji is Stasis and Father’s Sins is Void so they won’t compete. In that realm you’re looking at Praedyth’s Revenge which can get adept mods (should you have the adept version). If you have the adept version you can have incredibly high stats, 100 handling and 100 aim assist. Irukandji is great if you don’t have either of those options, but Father’s Sins is craftable and comes from the Witch Queen DLC. Certainly obtainable." |tags:pvp,controller

// Jorum's Claw
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Adaptive(390) Solar Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you’re really looking for consistency. The adaptive frame pulse rifles can two-burst with any damage bonus. This makes Kill Clip highly sought-after but having a more neutral pulse and surge mods can make this weapon also two-burst. With one surge mod you can two-burst all the way up to 7 resilience. Requiring all headshots. With two surge mods you can two-burst up to 8 resilience. 9 resilience with all three surge mods. Tier 10 will never get two bursted without Kill Clip but it’s nice to know if your RNG doesn’t favor you." |tags:pvp,controller

// Marsilion-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Rapid-Fire(150) Solar Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In the crucible you might want a different grenade launcher. Perpetual Motion is the best in slot for column three and Impulse Amplifier is the best for Column four. On other grenade launchers like Memory Interdict you can roll Impulse Amplifier with a better fourth column perk for either damage or consistency. Marsilion-C is great if you don’t have a grenade launcher for PvP but I would not rely on it being the best." |tags:pvp,controller

// Mykel's Reverence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Rapid-Fire(450) Strand Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "In PvP being a rapid-fire frame means this sidearm has extremely limited range. It will shut down shotgun apes and fusion rushers with ease but it does mean you are hard capped at around 15m of range. Being able to bring up the stability will make putting down those rushers easier but it will still require 5 crits and a body shot to kill 10 resilience Guardians. High risk decent reward." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(600) Strand Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In Crucible you can roll Keep Away and Target Lock for a great fast killing adaptive auto rifle. It stays above its competition by maintaining a good neutral stat spread and Target Lock. Arrowhead is great with a counterbalance mod for keeping the recoil nice and tight. Zen Moment is a great perk if you want to reduce flinch, especially useful now that Target Lock resets when you miss one shot. Being able to accurately hit your target is especially important on top of 600 autos having seen their day in the sun and need help." |tags:pvp,controller

// Phyllotactic Spiral
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. High-Impact(340) Arc Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can run a counterbalance mod or Arrowhead Brake if you prefer a different mod. Keep Away is the in slot and paired with Headseeker you will have a great neutral pulse rifle. If you get the jump on someone you’ll have the bonus range and a near perfect first burst. They turn on you, start flinching you, headseeker then comes into play to keep you on that two-burst. Kill Clip is another viable option for a more forgiving two-burst after your first kill, especially when paired with Tunnel Vision. Elemental Capacitor will only accentuate the neutral game of this pulse no matter what subclass you use. Whatever you use this pulse will be a great addition to any vault." |tags:pvp,controller

// Raconteur
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Draw Time. Precision(684) Stasis Combat Bow Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can definitely make this bow work. It is a precision frame for allowing bow blinting but doesn’t have a lot to really bump up Raconteur by itself. You can roll Gutshot Straight to make the bodyshot damage go up and pair it with a 120 hand cannon to body shot with the bow and headshot with the 120. Archer’s Tempo is helpful if you lane with Raconteur. Entirely up to you how you want to shape this bow, it’s underwhelming at but usable at worst." |tags:pvp,controller

// Regnant
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Adaptive(120) Void Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In PvP there are not a lot of interesting rolls for grenade launchers. You can roll Proximity Grenades for really reliable OHKs. Rangefinder makes the trajectory faster and Disruption Break can also help if you splash someone instead of getting that OHK, swapping to your kinetic for a 50 percent damage bonus. This can also help in 6s as any of your teammates get the 50 percent damage bonus after you break their shield. Helpful if you can coordinate with your team but also a nice bonus if you get it going." |tags:pvp,controller

// Round Robin
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Aggressive(120) Strand Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "In PvE Subsistence with Golden Tricorn will be your bread and butter for never ending shooting and a huge damage buff. This works with a build that ability loops by itself like Heart of Inmost Light. If you can keep up Golden Tricorn 2x constantly you will have an incredibly high damage hand cannon. Envious Assassin is an interesting perk as you’ll need to swap off your primary to get kills to overflow your magazine to swap back to your primary. If you are running double primary weapons in higher end content or just like to switch up weapons for clearing rooms you will love this perk. However, I just find it odd to need to swap off your primary to overflow your primary." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Charge Time. Adaptive(600) Solar Fusion Rifle Special Ammo. // Senuna SI6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Omolon Adaptive(491) Stasis Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Senuna SI6 is arguably the best three-burst sidearm. Slickdraw gives you 100 handling. A counterbalance mod gives you 99 recoil direction. You can then invest entirely into range as Omolon Fluid Dynamics will give you your stability. The only issue is the fourth column perk. Headstone is great in 3v3. Elemental Capacitor can bump up your stability on void, or forgo a counterbalance mod on Stasis. If you jump a lot then Strand could be a great option for you. Headseeker is another good option. Ideally I would run Headstone just for locking down that position and having some cover as well. Certainly a gun I will farm for and then throw in my vault to use on random loadout shenanigans." |tags:pvp,controller

// The Immortal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(750) Strand Submachine Gun Primary Ammo.  "Immortal is running the crucible and it is not hard to see why. A great submachine gun with some of the best stats for its family, Rangefinder in column three and Target Lock for an even faster TtK neutrally is hot. There’s nothing bad to say about Immortal other than a foreseeable nerf. Either to its stats, all aggressive frame submachine guns or a targeted nerf. An alternative would be Kill Clip as a more reliable damage source but we will just have to see what the end of this season brings." |tags:pvp,controller

// The Title
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range or Stability. Aggressive(750) Void Submachine Gun Primary Ammo.  "In PvP there is little to discuss. Rangefinder is best in slot and Perpetual Motion does make up for a good chunk of stats. Dynamic Sway Reduction also brings up the “stability” but I find it still needs more. 20 stability is just way too low. If you can swing it, it would be a good alternative to all the Immortals we are seeing." |tags:pvp,controller

// Trust
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(180) Solar Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "I am sad that Trust gained such a large perk pool as investing into all range will feel phenomenal. Rapid Hit will bring up your stability. A 180 hand cannon with 33m of range is incredible. You can also roll flinch machines with Opening Shot and Explosive Payload for slightly less range but great chip damage from afar. Depending on if you swap to Trust or feel like it will be your main weapon you can also opt for Eye of the Storm for better dueling, 180s have a slow time to kill so Eye of the Storm will keep your aim assist high at the end of that duel." |tags:pvp,controller

// Allied Demand
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Allied Demand is extremely similar to Buzzard, however, there will be no adept mods to bring up stats or damage in PvE. Rapid Hit is by and large the best perk to look for. Subsistence is also good if you’re in lower tiered PvE. Frenzy is the best in slot perk with either third column perk. Multikill Clip pairs better with Rapid Hit than Subsistence." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Astral Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=2653171213&perks=1300023272,3142289711,4071163871,47981717

// Astral Horizon (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Autumn Wind
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range or Stability. Rapid-Fire(540) Kinetic Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "It’s always fun when a weapon drops where it should perform. Arrowhead Brake and a counterbalance mod bring up the recoil direction to 100. Ricochet Rounds will bring up the stability or you can push out more flinch with High-Caliber Rounds. Rangefinder is in slot, but you can always increase your range through Killing Wind or more stability through Heating Up. If you would like a more stat boosted weapon you can roll with Elemental Capacitor and choose how this gun reacts." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Basso Ostinato
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range or Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Void Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Basso Ostinato does not compete well in PvP. Opening Shot does make up one of the two incredible shotgun perks. However, Perpetual Motion does not stack up as well compared to Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion 2x is still not even as strong of a handling buff as Threat Detector 1x. You will want to crank up the handling as much as possible. You will be okay using this shotgun at its possible version, however, you will just do better with a more dedicated PvP shotgun." |tags:pvp,mkb

With Slickdraw you can invest entirely into range and get 100 range and 100 handling even before Opening Shot. Moving Target will be more passive and grant you +10 Aim Assist. // Buzzard
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(300) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Buzzard with Rangefinder will have a 17m range, going all into range will only bump that up to 18m. I would highly recommend just investing your stats into making the gun feel better as your range will just not bump up the same way. You can max out stability without a lot of investments and Perpetual Motion 2x. Buzzard is an incredibly strong sidearm with incredible stats. Definitely give it a try if you like sidearms." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Compressed Wave(120) Stasis Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "I did not test this grenade launcher for a long period of time in PvP, but the same thing kept creeping into my mind. Having a heavy weapon that doesn’t one shot like its archetype siblings is just wrong. Having to fire twice and rely on architectures and level surfaces to kill is incredibly unfun. Do not use this in PvP until it gets a damage buff. Disruption Break is the perk for now as it will reliably break shields. I might update this once Dimensional Hypotrochoid gets a buff." |tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Handling. Rapid-Fire(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you can get a roll identical to Father’s Sins and similar to Praedyth’s Revenge. Father’s Sins does have lower zoom and is craftable for enhanced perks / enhanced intrinsic perk. The good news is that Irukandji is Stasis and Father’s Sins is Void so they won’t compete. In that realm you’re looking at Praedyth’s Revenge which can get adept mods (should you have the adept version). If you have the adept version you can have incredibly high stats, 100 handling and 100 aim assist. Irukandji is great if you don’t have either of those options, but Father’s Sins is craftable and comes from the Witch Queen DLC. Certainly obtainable." |tags:pvp,mkb

Pair those two with heavy investments into charge time and you will have a 336ms anti-shotgun. This might almost fire so quickly you won’t be able to precharge as often or aim as well. // Jorum's Claw
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(390) Solar Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you’re really looking for consistency. The adaptive frame pulse rifles can two-burst with any damage bonus. This makes Kill Clip highly sought-after but having a more neutral pulse and surge mods can make this weapon also two-burst. With one surge mod you can two-burst all the way up to 7 resilience. Requiring all headshots. With two surge mods you can two-burst up to 8 resilience. 9 resilience with all three surge mods. Tier 10 will never get two bursted without Kill Clip but it’s nice to know if your RNG doesn’t favor you." |tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=62937067&perks=839105230,1885400500,11551321,1015611457

// Marsilion-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Rapid-Fire(150) Solar Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In the crucible you might want a different grenade launcher. Perpetual Motion is the best in slot for column three and Impulse Amplifier is the best for Column four. On other grenade launchers like Memory Interdict you can roll Impulse Amplifier with a better fourth column perk for either damage or consistency. Marsilion-C is great if you don’t have a grenade launcher for PvP but I would not rely on it being the best." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Mykel's Reverence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Rapid-Fire(450) Strand Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "In PvP being a rapid-fire frame means this sidearm has extremely limited range. It will shut down shotgun apes and fusion rushers with ease but it does mean you are hard capped at around 15m of range. Being able to bring up the stability will make putting down those rushers easier but it will still require 5 crits and a body shot to kill 10 resilience Guardians. High risk decent reward." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Perpetualis
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive(600) Strand Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In Crucible you can roll Keep Away and Target Lock for a great fast killing adaptive auto rifle. It stays above its competition by maintaining a good neutral stat spread and Target Lock. Arrowhead is great with a counterbalance mod for keeping the recoil nice and tight. Zen Moment is a great perk if you want to reduce flinch, especially useful now that Target Lock resets when you miss one shot. Being able to accurately hit your target is especially important on top of 600 autos having seen their day in the sun and need help." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Phyllotactic Spiral
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. High-Impact(340) Arc Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can run a counterbalance mod or Arrowhead Brake if you prefer a different mod. Keep Away is the in slot and paired with Headseeker you will have a great neutral pulse rifle. If you get the jump on someone you’ll have the bonus range and a near perfect first burst. They turn on you, start flinching you, headseeker then comes into play to keep you on that two-burst. Kill Clip is another viable option for a more forgiving two-burst after your first kill, especially when paired with Tunnel Vision. Elemental Capacitor will only accentuate the neutral game of this pulse no matter what subclass you use. Whatever you use this pulse will be a great addition to any vault." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Raconteur
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Draw Time. Precision(684) Stasis Combat Bow Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can definitely make this bow work. It is a precision frame for allowing bow blinting but doesn’t have a lot to really bump up Raconteur by itself. You can roll Gutshot Straight to make the bodyshot damage go up and pair it with a 120 hand cannon to body shot with the bow and headshot with the 120. Archer’s Tempo is helpful if you lane with Raconteur. Entirely up to you how you want to shape this bow, it’s underwhelming at but usable at worst." |tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,3429800428,201365942,1365187766

// Regnant
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Adaptive(120) Void Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In PvP there are not a lot of interesting rolls for grenade launchers. You can roll Proximity Grenades for really reliable OHKs. Rangefinder makes the trajectory faster and Disruption Break can also help if you splash someone instead of getting that OHK, swapping to your kinetic for a 50 percent damage bonus. This can also help in 6s as any of your teammates get the 50 percent damage bonus after you break their shield. Helpful if you can coordinate with your team but also a nice bonus if you get it going." |tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=3525010810,409831596,2846385770,1683379515

// Round Robin
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Stability. Aggressive(120) Strand Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "In PvE Subsistence with Golden Tricorn will be your bread and butter for never ending shooting and a huge damage buff. This works with a build that ability loops by itself like Heart of Inmost Light. If you can keep up Golden Tricorn 2x constantly you will have an incredibly high damage hand cannon. Envious Assassin is an interesting perk as you’ll need to swap off your primary to get kills to overflow your magazine to swap back to your primary. If you are running double primary weapons in higher end content or just like to switch up weapons for clearing rooms you will love this perk. However, I just find it odd to need to swap off your primary to overflow your primary." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Royal Executioner
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Charge Time. Adaptive(600) Solar Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "Offhand Strike is perfect when attached with Killing Wind for better range, stability, and handling all at the same time. Arrowhead Brake is perfect for bringing up the recoil direction. You can drop down the charge time to make shotgun rushers mald. Successful Warm-Up is great if you want a more traditional fusion rifle experience. Slickdraw will bring up your handling so you can invest entirely into range. Firmly Planted and Elemental Capacitor will make the single shot experience feel great." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Senuna SI6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Omolon Adaptive(491) Stasis Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Senuna SI6 is arguably the best three-burst sidearm. Slickdraw gives you 100 handling. A counterbalance mod gives you 99 recoil direction. You can then invest entirely into range as Omolon Fluid Dynamics will give you your stability. The only issue is the fourth column perk. Headstone is great in 3v3. Elemental Capacitor can bump up your stability on void, or forgo a counterbalance mod on Stasis. If you jump a lot then Strand could be a great option for you. Headseeker is another good option. Ideally I would run Headstone just for locking down that position and having some cover as well. Certainly a gun I will farm for and then throw in my vault to use on random loadout shenanigans." |tags:pvp,mkb

// The Immortal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(750) Strand Submachine Gun Primary Ammo.  "Immortal is running the crucible and it is not hard to see why. There’s nothing bad to say about Immortal other than a foreseeable nerf. Either to its stats, all aggressive frame submachine guns or a targeted nerf. An alternative would be Kill Clip as a more reliable damage source but we will just have to see what the end of this season brings." |tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range. High-Impact(960) Kinetic Sidearm Primary Ammo. This will bring the charge time down to 600ms while keeping the damage per bolt at 51 and maintaining the four bolt kill." |tags:pvp,mkb

// Trust
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): Recommended MW: Range or Stability or Handling or Reload. Aggressive(180) Solar Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "I am sad that Trust gained such a large perk pool as investing into all range will feel phenomenal. Rapid Hit will bring up your stability. A 180 hand cannon with 33m of range is incredible. You can also roll flinch machines with Opening Shot and Explosive Payload for slightly less range but great chip damage from afar. Depending on if you swap to Trust or feel like it will be your main weapon you can also opt for Eye of the Storm for better dueling, 180s have a slow time to kill so Eye of the Storm will keep your aim assist high at the end of that duel." |tags:pvp,mkb
